articles.description: Follow live text updates as Man Utd visit Paris St-Germain in the second leg of their Women's Champions League qualifying tie.
articles.title: Women's Champions League: Build-up to PSG v Man Utd

articles.description: Springbok legend Joel Stransky discusses South Africa's 'brutal' Rugby World Cup quarter-final win over France and backs the holders to see off England in the semis.
articles.title: 'I will fall over backwards if South Africa lose'

articles.description: Newcastle United confirm midfielder Sandro Tonali is being investigated in relation to alleged illegal betting activity.
articles.title: Newcastle confirm Tonali faces betting investigation

articles.description: Follow live text updates of Glasgow City's second-leg Women's Champions League, champions' path Round 2 play-off against Brann.
articles.title: Live: Brann v Glasgow City in Women's Champions League

articles.description: New Zealand remain unbeaten in the World Cup after beating Afghanistan by 149 runs in Chennai.
articles.title: NZ thrash Afghanistan to remain unbeaten in World Cup

articles.description: Worcester Warriors director of rugby Jo Yapp says Cube international's decision to withdraw funding came "out of the blue".
articles.title: Warriors 'heartbroken' by funding loss - Yapp

articles.description: Sheffield United manager Jonathan Morgan is under investigation by the club following a formal complaint over his alleged conduct and behaviour.
articles.title: Sheff Utd boss Morgan under investigation by club

articles.description: Investigators give the BBC insight into the match-fixing scandal involving 10 Chinese players and steps they are taking to help prevent corruption.
articles.title: 'Perfect storm' led to snooker match-fixing scandal

articles.description: Danny Care is preparing for a "hell of a test" against South Africa, four years after being unable to watch England's World Cup final loss.
articles.title: 'It hit me what I was missing out on' - Care on World Cup

articles.description: New Zealand's Mitchell Santner takes a stunning diving catch to dismiss Afghanistan captain Hashmatullah Shahidi in the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 match in Chennai.
articles.title: NZ's Santner takes 'astonishing' running catch
